attributes.action: Hold a vote in Parliament before any 'Bathroom Bill' style legislation is passed
attributes.additional_details: We know that this legislation stands to be harmful to both trans people and gender non confirming cisgender (non transgender people) who some might confuse as being members of another gender.
attributes.background: We are asking that a Parliamentary vote is held, before any primary legislation is passed that mandates that transgender persons cannot use the toilets of the gender that they live as.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Bills that go through Parliament already have to be voted on.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
